definition: to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve

sentences.english: Security officials rushed down the main aisle to detain the woman.
sentences.chinese: 安全官员立马冲进主通道，扣留了该名女子。

sentences.english: The customs house shall make examination on the person under custody within the legal detention period.
sentences.chinese: 海关应当在法定扣留期限内对被扣留人进行审查。

sentences.english: The customs house shall make examination on the person under custody within the legal detention period.
sentences.chinese: 海关应当在法定扣留期限内对被扣留人进行审查。

sentences.english: My emissaries would certainly be detained .
sentences.chinese: 我的密使一定会被扣留。

sentences.english: So the same evening the police detained the father of Li-Li then.
sentences.chinese: 于是当天晚上警方便将丽丽的父亲扣留。

sentences.english: Tensions had escalated since Japan detained the Chinese captain.
sentences.chinese: 日方扣留中方船长是双方紧张局势升级。

sentences.english: I did not expect to be detained by the KMT in Xi'an, held in Xi'an reformatory.
sentences.chinese: 没想到在西安关卡被国民党扣留，关押在西安感化院。

sentences.english: If the STOP is negative, then the suspect herd can be released.
sentences.chinese: 如果检验结果呈阴性，可以解除对所怀疑畜群的扣留。

sentences.english: Currently, prosecutorscannot be prosecuted for withholding exculpatory evidence.
sentences.chinese: 一般，起诉人不会由于扣留无罪证据而受到起诉。

sentences.english: By withholding beauty, artists aimed to punish a culture of destruction for its own sordidness.
sentences.chinese: 通过扣留美，艺术家的目的是惩罚肮脏的破坏的文化。

sentences.english: The soldier was interned in a neutral country until the war was over.
sentences.chinese: 这些士兵被扣留在中立国直到战争结束。

sentences.english: I would rather withhold than uphold you unfold the gold foil on the threshold.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿扣留而不支持你展开黄金箔在门槛上。

sentences.english: The diplomatic bag shall not be opened or detained.
sentences.chinese: 外交邮袋不得开拆或者扣留。

sentences.english: The "held" deposits must be displayed when kids view their passbooks.
sentences.chinese: 当小孩看存折时，必须显示“扣留”的存款。

sentences.english: I'll need to write you a ticket and impound your vehicle.
sentences.chinese: 我必须开罚单给你，并且扣留你的车子。

sentences.english: The Customs shall examine the detainee within the time limit of detention specified by law.
sentences.chinese: 海关应当在法定扣留期限内对被扣留人进行审查。

definition: to detain/to hold in custody/to distrain/to seize property
to recover (illegally obtained property)/to seize/to capture/to force sb to hand over sth/to levy
to detain (a prisoner)/to keep sb in custody
to sequester/to seize (assets)/to seal up/to close down
to withhold/to hold sth back (and prevent it being known)
to send under escort/to transport a detainee
